data.enText: a part of sth that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately

data.chText: 她擦干净了这幅画的一小部分。
data.enText: She cleaned a small segment of the painting.

data.chText: 这一地区用线条分成了若干部分。
data.enText: Lines divided the area into segments.
one of the sections of an orange, a lemon, etc.
a part of a circle separated from the rest by a single line
the smallest speech sound that a word can be divided into
to divide sth into different parts

data.chText: 市场研究人员常常按年龄和社会阶层划分人口。
data.enText: Market researchers often segment the population on the basis of age and social class.

data.chText: 这条虫子的身体是分节的。
data.enText: The worm has a segmented body (= with different sections joined together) .

simple_means.memory_skill: seg 切，割 + ment 具体物 → 部分，一段

tr: one of several parts or pieces that fit with others to constitute a whole object
example: a section of a fishing rod
metal sections were used below ground
finished the final segment of the road

tr: one of the parts into which something naturally divides

value.boxr_value: The noun is pronounced /'segmənt/. The verb is pronounced /seg'ment/. 名词读作 /'segmənt/。动词读作 /seg'ment/。

value.def: A segment of something is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.
A segment of fruit such as an orange or grapefruit is one of the sections into which it is easily divided.
A segment of a circle is one of the two parts into which it is divided when you draw a straight line through it.
A segment of a market is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.

example.ex: Three-to-five day cruises are the fastest-growing segment of the market...
example.tran: 3 至 5 天的乘船游览是该市场中发展最快的部分。

example.ex: Women's tennis is the market leader in a growing market segment — women's sports.
example.tran: 女子网球正引领着一个逐渐壮大的市场——女子运动市场。

value.def: If a company segments a market, it divides it into separate parts, usually in order to improve marketing opportunities.

example.ex: The big six record companies are multinational, and thus can segment the world market into national ones.
example.tran: 六大唱片公司都是跨国经营，因此能够将世界市场按国家划分。

trans: 子市场；市场划分；市场细分；细分市场；市场区隔
软段结构；软段；软链段；柔性链段；和软链段
即子宫下段；评估子宫下段；下段；评价子宫下段；下集
线单元边长；长度；慎重选择段长；线段长度；片段长度
代码段；代码区；代码段寄存器；程式段；码段

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to cut, to divide 切, 割
rootsaffixes.title: sect, seg

partsOfSpeech.dec: bi 二 + sect 切，割 → 二等分
dis 加强 + sect 切，割 → 切分 → 解剖
dissect 解剖 + ion 表名词 → 解剖
inter 在…之间 + sect 切，割 → 从中间切开 → 横切
intersect 横切；交叉 + ion 表名词 → 横切；交叉
sect 切，割 + ion 表名词 → 切开；部门
section 切开；部门 + al …的 → 可组合的；部门的
sect 切，割 + or 表名词 → 部分；部门
seg 切，割 + ment 具体物 → 切开后的东西 → 切片
segment 部分；切片 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 割成几部分 → 分裂
tran〔= trans 横〕+ sect 切，割 → 横着切 → 横断
vivi 活 + sect 切，割 → 活着切开 → 活体解剖
advertise 做广告 + ment 行为或结果 → 广告
agree 同意 + ment 行为或结果 → 协议
allure 诱惑 + ment 行为或结果 → 诱惑物
amuse 使愉快 + ment 行为或结果 → 娱乐，消遣
develop 发展 + ment 行为或结果 → 发展
enact 颁布 + ment 行为或结果 → （法令）颁布
establish 建立 + ment 行为或结果 → 建立
frag 破碎，打碎 + ment 行为或结果 → 碎片
harass 骚扰 + ment 行为或结果 → 烦恼；骚扰
manage 管理 + ment 行为或结果 → 管理
move 动 + ment 行为或结果 → 运动
state 声明 + ment 行为或结果 → 声明
base 基础 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 地下室
embank 筑堤 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 堤岸；路堤
equip 配备，装备 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 设备
govern 统治；管理 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 政府；管理
nutri 滋养 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 营养品
pave 铺路 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 人行道
seg 切，割 + ment 具体物，组织或机构 → 部分，一段
